entries.title: Japan shrugs as Gwen Stefani’s ‘cultural appropriation’ roils US
entries.description: Japanese people say they are bemused at controversy over US pop singer's fascination with their culture.

entries.title: Is Tunisia a failed democracy?
entries.description: Tunisian protesters accuse President Kais Saied of orchestrating a power grab and harming the economy.

entries.title: Former Afghan lawmaker Mursal Nabizada shot dead in Kabul
entries.description: Nabizada, former member of parliament in the US-backed government, was killed by assailants at her home, police say.

entries.title: NATO chief hints at more heavy weapons deliveries to Ukraine
entries.description: Jens Stoltenberg says he expects more weapons deliveries to war-torn Ukraine after UK pledges Challenger 2 tanks.

entries.title: Israel’s Cognyte won Myanmar spyware tender before coup
entries.description: Israeli firm won contract with a Myanmar state-backed telecoms firm a month before 2021 coup, according to documents.

entries.title: Climate activists in Davos protest over role of oil firms at WEF
entries.description: Activists at Swiss resort demand stronger action to tackle the climate crisis at the World Economic Forum.

entries.title: Iraq prime minister al-Sudani backs continued US troop presence
entries.description: Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani says foreign forces still needed in training capacity to combat ISIL (ISIS).

entries.title: Rescue hopes fade after Russian attack on Dnipro apartment block
entries.description: At least 30 killed after Russian attack as mayor of Ukrainian city says there is little hope of finding more survivors.

entries.title: Grim task of identifying the dead begins after Nepal plane crash
entries.description: Gov't to probe Yeti Airlines flight that crashed on way from Kathmandu to Pokhara with 72 on board, killing at least 68.

entries.title: Netanyahu defiant despite protests against Israel judicial reform
entries.description: Opponents say changes would cripple judicial independence, foster corruption, set back minority rights.

entries.title: Several killed in DR Congo church bomb attack
entries.description: Attack took place during a Sunday service in the eastern city of Kasindi, the army said.

entries.title: Analysis: Akbari execution signals rising Iran tensions with West
entries.description: The execution of the former deputy defence minister has led to a backlash from the UK, where he had held citizenship.

entries.title: Biden declares disaster in California amid deadly storms
entries.description: At least 19 people are known to have died from storm-related causes in the last three weeks.

entries.title: Qatar’s Nasser al-Attiyah wins Dakar Rally for the fifth time
entries.description: Al-Attiyah wins his second title in a row as the test of endurance ends in Dammam, Saudi Arabia.

entries.title: ‘We have no one’: The women and girls sold as brides in Kashmir
entries.description: For as little as $35, Indian women and girls are being sold by traffickers and forced into marriages against their will.

entries.title: Israel soldier killed in grenade accident: Military
entries.description: Three others were wounded in the incident, according to the Israeli army, with one said to be in a serious condition.

entries.title: Israelis rally against Netanyahu government
entries.description: Israelis took to the streets to protest plans by Benjamin Netanyahu's new government to change the legal system.

entries.title: PSG could leave Parc des Princes after mayor turns down sale
entries.description: French champions exploring 'alternative options' after Paris mayor says Parc des Princes is not for sale.

entries.title: Critical Race Theory? No, Critical Race Fact
entries.description: Critical Race Theory researchers have gathered enough evidence by now that the dynamics they explore are a hard reality.

entries.title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian ‘after argument’ near Ramallah
entries.description: Ahmed Kahla, 45, is the 13th Palestinian to be killed by Israelis in 15 days.

entries.title: Timeline: Nepal air crashes since 2010
entries.description: A timeline of major air disasters to hit the country since 2010.

entries.title: Photos: Graves sink, fisheries shrink as climate change hits Fiji
entries.description: The government estimates more than 600 communities could be forced to move, including 42 villages under urgent threat.

entries.title: Timeline: Algeria and Morocco’s diplomatic disputes
entries.description: Algiers and Rabat involved in another spat as Morocco condemns 'provocative' acts at a football tournament in Algeria.

entries.title: Photos: Plane carrying 72 people crashes in Nepal
entries.description: The aircraft, operated by Nepal's Yeti Airline, crashed between the old and new Pokhara airports in central Nepal.

entries.title: Morocco condemns ‘provocative’ acts at Algeria football cup
entries.description: Rabat is unhappy with comments made by Nelson Mandela's grandson in which he called to 'free' Western Sahara.

entries.title: Peru declares state of emergency in Lima over protests
entries.description: Protests against President Boluarte have taken place since Castillo was removed from office in December and detained.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 326
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 326th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Death toll in Philippine storms rises to 27
entries.description: More rain forecast in the Philippines as 83,000 people take shelter in evacuation centres.

entries.title: Plane with 72 people on board crashes in Nepal
entries.description: State television reported some bodies had been recovered from the crash site in the west of the small Himalayan country.

entries.title: Lottery ticket holder in Maine wins $1.35bn Mega Millions Jackpot
entries.description: Organisers say the single winning ticket was sold in rural Maine.
